intro: Fagonia bischarorum, commonly known as the Socotra caper, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula, specifically the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spine-like leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and can thrive in rocky soils with minimal water. It is also notable for its ability to produce a resin that has been used traditionally in various applications.
